caption.p: Brain MRI findings from the fifth and sixth MRI scans. Fifth MRI scan (on day 132): axial FLAIR showed persistent meningo-cortical hyperintensity ( Y, arrows) and new lesions around the temporal lobe, posterior limb of internal capsule (right), and left trigone of the lateral ventricle (Uâ€“X). Sixth MRI scan (on day 148): axial FLAIR showed substantial reductions in the original lesions without new lesion formation ( Z, AA, BB, and CC), and the meningo-cortical FLAIR hyperintensity disappeared (DD).
